1.brief: used very widely as demonstrative, lo!; interrogative, whether?; or conditional, if, although; also Oh that!, when; hence, as a negative, not
to turn back (hence, away) transitively or intransitively, literally or figuratively (not necessarily with the idea of return to the starting point); generally to retreat; often adverbial, again
Jisrael, a symbolical name of Jacob; also (typically) of his posterity
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
near, with or among; often in general, to
to turn back (hence, away) transitively or intransitively, literally or figuratively (not necessarily with the idea of return to the starting point); generally to retreat; often adverbial, again
used very widely as demonstrative, lo!; interrogative, whether?; or conditional, if, although; also Oh that!, when; hence, as a negative, not
disgusting, i.e. filthy; especially idolatrous or (concretely) an idol
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to nod, i.e. waver; figuratively, to wander, flee, disappear; also (from shaking the head in sympathy), to console, deplore, or (from tossing the head in scorn) taunt

2.brief: to seven oneself, i.e. swear (as if by repeating a declaration seven times)
alive; hence, raw (flesh); fresh (plant, water, year), strong; also (as noun, especially in the feminine singular and masculine plural) life (or living thing), whether literally or figuratively
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God

properly, a verdict (favorable or unfavorable) pronounced judicially, especially a sentence or formal decree (human or (participant's) divine law, individual or collective), including the act, the place, the suit, the crime, and the penalty; abstractly, justice, including a participant's right or privilege (statutory or customary), or even a style
rightness (abstractly), subjectively (rectitude), objectively (justice), morally (virtue) or figuratively (prosperity)
to kneel; by implication to bless God (as an act of adoration), and (vice-versa) man (as a benefit); also (by euphemism) to curse (God or the king, as treason)
a foreign nation; hence, a Gentile; also (figuratively) a troop of animals, or a flight of locusts
to be clear (orig. of sound, but usually of color); to shine; hence, to make ashow, to boast; and thus to be (clamorously) foolish; to rave; causatively, to celebrate; also to stultify

3.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
properly, like this, i.e. by implication, (of manner) thus (or so); also (of place) here (or hither); or (of time) now
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
a man as an individual or a male person; often used as an adjunct to a more definite term (and in such cases frequently not expressed in translation)
Jehudah (or Judah), the name of five Israelites; also of the tribe descended from the first, and of its territory
Jerushalaim or Jerushalem, the capital city of Palestine
properly, plowing, i.e. (concretely) freshly plowed land
not (the qualified negation, used as a deprecative); once (Job 24:25) as a noun, nothing
to sow; figuratively, to disseminate, plant, fructify
near, with or among; often in general, to

4.brief: to cut short, i.e. curtail (specifically the prepuce, i.e. to circumcise); by implication, to blunt; figuratively, to destroy
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
the heart (as the most interior organ);
a man as an individual or a male person; often used as an adjunct to a more definite term (and in such cases frequently not expressed in translation)
Jehudah (or Judah), the name of five Israelites; also of the tribe descended from the first, and of its territory
properly, to sit down (specifically as judge. in ambush, in quiet); by implication, to dwell, to remain; causatively, to settle, to marry
Jerushalaim or Jerushalem, the capital city of Palestine
properly, removal; used only (in the construction) adverb as conjunction, lest
to go (causatively, bring) out, in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively, direct and proxim.
heat; figuratively, anger, poison (from its fever)
to kindle, i.e. consume (by fire or by eating);  to be(-come) brutish
a non-entity; generally used as a negative particle
to expire or (causatively) to extinguish (fire, light, anger)
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)

Jehudah (or Judah), the name of five Israelites; also of the tribe descended from the first, and of its territory
Jerushalaim or Jerushalem, the capital city of Palestine
to hear intelligently (often with implication of attention, obedience, etc.; causatively, to tell, etc.)
to clatter, i.e. slap (the hands together), clang (an instrument); by analogy, to drive (a nail or tent-pin, a dart, etc.); by implication, to become bondsman by handclasping)
a cornet (as giving a clear sound) or curved horn
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)
to call out to (i.e. properly, address by name, but used in a wide variety of applications)
to fill or (intransitively) be full of, in a wide application (literally and figuratively)
to gather for any purpose; hence, to receive, take away, i.e. remove (destroy, leave behind, put up, restore, etc.)
to go or come (in a wide variety of applications)
near, with or among; often in general, to
a city (a place guarded by waking or a watch) in the widest sense (even of a mere encampment or post)
a fortification, castle, or fortified city; figuratively, a defender

a flag; also a sail; by implication, a flagstaff; generally a signal; figuratively, a token
Tsijon (as a permanent capital), a mountain of Jerusalem
to be strong; causatively, to stregthen, i.e. (figuratively) to save (by flight)
not (the qualified negation, used as a deprecative); once (Job 24:25) as a noun, nothing
to stand, in various relations (literal and figurative, intransitive and transitive)

bad or (as noun) evil (natural or moral)

a fracture, figuratively, ruin; specifically, a solution (of a dream)
great (in any sense); hence, older; also insolent

to decay, i.e. (causatively) ruin (literally or figuratively)
a foreign nation; hence, a Gentile; also (figuratively) a troop of animals, or a flight of locusts
properly, to pull up, especially the tent-pins, i.e. start on ajourney
to go (causatively, bring) out, in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively, direct and proxim.

the earth (at large, or partitively a land)
a city (a place guarded by waking or a watch) in the widest sense (even of a mere encampment or post)

to gird on (as a belt, armor, etc.)

to howl (with a wailing tone) or yell (with a boisterous one)

to turn back (hence, away) transitively or intransitively, literally or figuratively (not necessarily with the idea of return to the starting point); generally to retreat; often adverbial, again
properly, a part of; hence (prepositionally), from or out of in many senses

29.brief: a steed (as stretched out to a vehicle, not single nor for mounting ); also (by implication) a driver (in a chariot), i.e. (collectively) cavalry
to hurl; specifically, to shoot; figuratively, to delude or betray (as if causing to fall)
a bow, forshooting (hence, figuratively, strength) or the iris
to bolt, i.e. figuratively, to flee suddenly
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
a city (a place guarded by waking or a watch) in the widest sense (even of a mere encampment or post)
to go or come (in a wide variety of applications)
properly, an envelope, i.e. darkness (or density, 2 Chronicles 4:17); specifically, a (scud) cloud; also a copse
to ascend, intransitively (be high) or actively (mount); used in a great variety of senses, primary and secondary, literal and figurative
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
a city (a place guarded by waking or a watch) in the widest sense (even of a mere encampment or post)
to loosen, i.e. relinquish, permit, etc.
a non-entity; generally used as a negative particle
properly, to sit down (specifically as judge. in ambush, in quiet); by implication, to dwell, to remain; causatively, to settle, to marry
a man as an individual or a male person; often used as an adjunct to a more definite term (and in such cases frequently not expressed in translation)

30.brief: thou and thee, or (plural) ye and you
properly, to be burly, i.e. (figuratively) powerful (passively, impregnable); by implication, to ravage

properly, interrogative what? (including how? why? when?); but also exclamation, what! (including how!), or indefinitely what (including whatever, and even relatively, that which); often used with prefixes in various adverbial or conjunctive senses
to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
properly, wrap around, i.e. (by implication) to put on agarment or clothe (oneself, or another), literally or figuratively
crimson, properly, the insect or its color, also stuff dyed with it
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
to advance, i.e. pass on or continue; causatively, to remove; specifically, to bedeck (i.e. bring an ornament upon)
finery; generally an outfit; specifically, a headstall
gold, figuratively, something gold-colored (i.e. yellow), as oil, a clear sky
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
to rend, literally or figuratively (revile, paint the eyes, as if enlarging them)
dye (specifically, stibium for the eyes)
an eye (literally or figuratively); by analogy, a fountain (as the eye of the landscape)
evil (as destructive), literally (ruin) or morally (especially guile); figuratively idolatry (as false, subjective), uselessness (as deceptive, objective; also adverbially, in vain)
properly, to be bright, i.e. (by implication) beautiful
to spurn; also (intransitively) to disappear
to breathe after, i.e. to love (sensually)
properly, a breathing creature, i.e. animal of (abstractly) vitality; used very widely in a literal, accommodated or figurative sense (bodily or mental)
to search out (by any method, specifically in worship or prayer); by implication, to strive after

31.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
properly, to be rubbed or worn; hence (figuratively) to be weak, sick, afflicted; or (causatively) to grieve, make sick; also to stroke (in flattering), entreat
to hear intelligently (often with implication of attention, obedience, etc.; causatively, to tell, etc.)
tightness (i.e. figuratively, trouble); transitively, a female rival:
a daughter (used in the same wide sense as other terms of relationship, literally and figuratively)
Tsijon (as a permanent capital), a mountain of Jerusalem
properly, to breathe hard, i.e. (by implication) to sigh
the hollow hand or palm (so of the paw of an animal, of the sole, and even of the bowl of a dish or sling, the handle of a bolt, the leaves of a palm-tree); figuratively, power
'I pray', 'now', or 'then'; added mostly to verbs (in the Imperative or Future), or to interjections, occasionally to an adverb or conjunction
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
properly, a breathing creature, i.e. animal of (abstractly) vitality; used very widely in a literal, accommodated or figurative sense (bodily or mental)
